disp-quote.p: “We do not strive to be like the others but rather offer refreshing content that sometimes goes against the grain.”

body.p: Idon’t know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody. So ends another successful year at Foot & Ankle Specialist (FAS), our fifth year. We have enjoyed bringing you innovative content that emphasizes practical discussions alongside peer-reviewed scientific explorations. We do not strive to be like the others but rather offer refreshing content that sometimes goes against the grain.
Lowell and I cannot do this without the tremendous support from our editorial team at SAGE (Jesse Soll, Craig Percy, Erin Nelson, Amanda Richardson, and Melissa Stevens).
We cannot overemphasize how much we appreciate the dedication of our editorial board and our section editors. Dr Schuberth, Dr DeVries, Dr Hyer, and Dr. Cook—thank you!

Finally, to our reviewers—thank you for your time, your patience with articles that need your important input, and for your continued support of FAS. Our honor list of reviewers that have reviewed 4 or more articles for FAS in 2012:

Alan Catanzariti, William DeCarbo, Ari Kaz, Erin Klein, Thomas Harris, Christian Kinast, Jarrod Shapiro, Wenjay Sung, Arush Angirasa, Jeffrey Baker, Bradly Bussewitz, Matthew Crill, Ryan Fitzgerald, Glenn Garcia, Safet Hatic, Peter Highlander, Pal Ramesh.
In 2013, FAS will continue to innovate with new focus sections on surgical techniques and business topics.
